text:
I'm creating a list of freelance graphic designers for blog images, infographics, and social media pics.

Who have you worked with and should be included?

elements.text:
I'm creating a list of freelance graphic designers for blog images, infographics, and social media pics.

Who have you worked with and should be included?

text: I'm a bit confused. Are you asking for folks who have build links for their brands? If so, we've increased our DR from 3 to 14 in 6 weeks. If not, could you please elaborate a bit?

elements.text: I'm a bit confused. Are you asking for folks who have build links for their brands? If so, we've increased our DR from 3 to 14 in 6 weeks. If not, could you please elaborate a bit?

text: Only freelance or productized services work too?

elements.text: Only freelance or productized services work too?

text: +1 for Intercom. InVision is pretty good, too!

elements.text: +1 for Intercom. InVision is pretty good, too!

text: Ya any brand based example would be great. But if you have any other idea or use case you want to discuss, i’d love to know that too. <@U016UC1UQEN>

elements.text: Ya any brand based example would be great. But if you have any other idea or use case you want to discuss, i’d love to know that too.

text: Hey <@U019F15SA7Q> - happy to share a few examples of blogs that I’ve built links to (all without spammy outreach).

elements.text: Hey
- happy to share a few examples of blogs that I’ve built links to (all without spammy outreach).

text: ISO: Website agency for a 3-6 month project. Ideally looking for an agency with both engineering/design and copywriting skills to support a small team. One we looked at so far was Orbit Media but they unfortunately don't have availability. Appreciate the references and happy to add more detail if that helps narrow things down.

elements.text: ISO: Website agency for a 3-6 month project. Ideally looking for an agency with both engineering/design and copywriting skills to support a small team. One we looked at so far was Orbit Media but they unfortunately don't have availability. Appreciate the references and happy to add more detail if that helps narrow things down.

text:
Hi <@U019F15SA7Q>! Interested in this :slightly_smiling_face:

My agency grew it's DR from 0 to 73 in just a few months building genuine backlinks to long-form content on our blog. We've also done the same for many other blogs. Would love to know more!

You're welcome to reach out to the agency where I work. We do design, dev, and I head up the content and SEO team. I'll DM you the contact details.

text: The core OKRs are lowering CAC and increasing LTV. There are a ton of ways to impact those levers but those two are the key ingredients in profitability and a sustainable ecom business.

elements.text: The core OKRs are lowering CAC and increasing LTV. There are a ton of ways to impact those levers but those two are the key ingredients in profitability and a sustainable ecom business.

text: Does anyone involved in hiring full-time content writers have a go-to candidate screening test (e.g. a short 30-60 min. writing assignment)? I'd like to be able to assess candidates on what they can do without an editor and with a bit of time pressure (while also avoiding asking for lots of unpaid work). Also open to alternatives!

elements.text: Does anyone involved in hiring full-time content writers have a go-to candidate screening test (e.g. a short 30-60 min. writing assignment)? I'd like to be able to assess candidates on what they can do without an editor and with a bit of time pressure (while also avoiding asking for lots of unpaid work). Also open to alternatives!

text: Hey, Eric. We ask content writing candidates to create a "project" that explains our company to a stranger. It's intentionally vague. Some winning examples: a board game and a website quiz.

elements.text: Hey, Eric. We ask content writing candidates to create a "project" that explains our company to a stranger. It's intentionally vague. Some winning examples: a board game and a website quiz.

text: I usually ask for a really short piece of writing--e.g. a 300-word mini article about the kind of topic we’d actually ask them to write on, and part of the assignment is also “tell me what you would’ve done with more time.” I’d love to hear how others approach getting a useful sample in a short amount of time.

elements.text: I usually ask for a really short piece of writing--e.g. a 300-word mini article about the kind of topic we’d actually ask them to write on, and part of the assignment is also “tell me what you would’ve done with more time.” I’d love to hear how others approach getting a useful sample in a short amount of time.

text:
<@U01HD8ACQHG> Do you place any time limits on this? I'm hesitant to ask for too much free work.

<@URB31QKM4> That sounds reasonable! I like the open-endedness of what they'd do with more time.

elements.text: Do you place any time limits on this? I'm hesitant to ask for too much free work.
That sounds reasonable! I like the open-endedness of what they'd do with more time.

text: It’s been super interesting because some folks will write way more, but the “what I’d do with more time” is edit. Vs. some folks stick right within the word count, but focus on how they’d expand the article or the sections they’d want to incorporate, or research they want to do, etc. There isn’t a specific right answer but it is helpful to see their writing as well as to discuss their process in the final interview.

elements.text: It’s been super interesting because some folks will write way more, but the “what I’d do with more time” is edit. Vs. some folks stick right within the word count, but focus on how they’d expand the article or the sections they’d want to incorporate, or research they want to do, etc. There isn’t a specific right answer but it is helpful to see their writing as well as to discuss their process in the final interview.

text: What's your turnaround time for the assignment?

elements.text: What's your turnaround time for the assignment?

text: <@U01G7PRL3HQ> I think the assignment specs say it shouldn't take longer than five minutes to present - it should demonstrate your writing abilities but not be an article or report. For context, our marketing org is divided by Brand Management, Demand Gen, and Creative. The writers are on the creative team which is probably why it's unconventional. Our turnaround time depends on the CMO's schedule which frankly varies quite a bit.

elements.text: I think the assignment specs say it shouldn't take longer than five minutes to present - it should demonstrate your writing abilities but not be an article or report. For context, our marketing org is divided by Brand Management, Demand Gen, and Creative. The writers are on the creative team which is probably why it's unconventional. Our turnaround time depends on the CMO's schedule which frankly varies quite a bit.

text: Thanks <@URB31QKM4> and <@U01HD8ACQHG> :pray:

elements.text: Thanks
and

text: Hey all. Just asked this question on Twitter. I'd be curious to see the answers from the marketing leaders here: <https://twitter.com/davidhoos/status/1341524443948978177>

<https://twitter.com/davidhoos|@davidhoos>: Calling all B2B content marketing leaders.

When thinking about scaling your content program, what approach do you typically lean toward in your company?
attachments.text:
Calling all B2B content marketing leaders.

When thinking about scaling your content program, what approach do you typically lean toward in your company?

elements.text: Hey all. Just asked this question on Twitter. I'd be curious to see the answers from the marketing leaders here:

text: Thanks for all the responses! So for some clarification- I would ideally like the example to be a link building campaign for a particular blog post rather than just a campaign that built links back to the homepage of a website. Does that make more sense? Thanks everyone!

elements.text: Thanks for all the responses! So for some clarification- I would ideally like the example to be a link building campaign for a particular blog post rather than just a campaign that built links back to the homepage of a website. Does that make more sense? Thanks everyone!
